body: It makes a copy of the `AnyModule`, but this in turn makes a copy of the `shared_ptr<Module>` it has inside. So it's more like a shallow copy. I agree that to be consistent with the rest of the library, deep copies should be explicit.
body_html: It makes a copy of the AnyModule, but this in turn makes a copy of the shared_ptr<Module> it has inside. So it's more like a shallow copy. I agree that to be consistent with the rest of the library, deep copies should be explicit.
body_text: It makes a copy of the AnyModule, but this in turn makes a copy of the shared_ptr<Module> it has inside. So it's more like a shallow copy. I agree that to be consistent with the rest of the library, deep copies should be explicit.
